caption: Heated outdoor seating. Good drinks, great sushi. I recommend the roll with the softshell crab!
This place was amazing. Honestly one of the best sushi restaurants I've been to in the US.
We almost froze outside
Great rolls cool vibe
Had an amazing dinner at Zeppelin. Sushi was delicious, service was great. But the cocktails were not very good.
Very good maki (especially the Zeppelin one) and lovely service, thanks!

Not a great experience,  really slow service and portions of sushi are cut even smaller than many other sushi restaurants  I have ever been to in the DC area and they over charge for sushi that would normally be 3 to 5 dollars cheaper at most places.... Now I just wish I would have taken photos to let you guys see what the heck i am talking about...I will give them another try because just maybe they didn't have much of the seafood that I ordered or maybe the owner was just being cheap🤫 who the hell knows but I will take many photos next time for you guys. I will try again this weekend so look out for the post...oh and make sure you follow me on here  " Google maps " or Instagram @chefkamalc  😏
Good place, drinks tasty

Another DC spot trying to sell style over substance.  Let's be clear:  the staff is polite, but there is only so much you can do with this type of menu.  It's expensive for okay food, but they seem to have bought their own hype, yet the food is not next level.  It's a normal sushi spot pretending to be something else.  The food is not worth the price, and the decor is just a poor man's version of what a nice place should be.  Go elsewhere.
I'm not happy with my order.  Taste fine, but very small portions.  Just not worth it.

Overpriced spot that adds 18% gratuity for pick up orders.  "We explained it to you when you pick up the order, sir.  Our computer automatically adds the 18%." Additionally, the maki was supermarket quality.  What are you selling me?  It's a pick-up order - so, not experience, service, just food.  The food was meh.  I knew what I was getting into.  I was going to pay too much, but I wanted sushi and I wanted to support a local business.  What did they do, underperform and try to grab more money.

We enjoyed our dinner on the patio.  Zeppelin has done a great job adapting to Covid, with shields between tables, heat lamps for the patio, and making sure everyone wears masks (aside from eating & drinking at the table).  Our server was attentive, made good suggestions, and the food was great!

Good but not great. Very limited sushi menu. By that i mean sushi does not have to always be shellfish. They have hardly any options that are not shrimp and crab based. We asked for a couple of minor modifications and they got some right, some wrong. The rolls we got were good but not overly impressive.  On the upside... The staff is ridiculously nice, so you can't really be annoyed with mistakes because they are definitely and cheerfully trying to do their best.

Covid procedure: Check (loved the spacing outside and optional heaters, hand sanitizer & also QR menus) Cocktails: Check (Hit me with a highball menu anytime. Also, my friend had 2 Heartbrekers, they were spicy and strong) Sushi: BLESSS. I had a two special rolls and they were delicious. The chef's choice sushi platter my friend got was also dope. In addition to a lot of sushi and sashimi, it also included two little roll samples. Really fresh and healthy, a solid portion.
Great service!!!
Zeppelin has very friendly staff, spaced out seating and high quality sushi! Fish is very fresh and its comfortable to sit on their patio with one of their cocktails and sushi!

Excellent experience at Zeppelin. This review is a COVID era one:  Quality price *5 Sitting and atmosphere: chill and calm. Perfect for friends hangout or a date  - The servers were all wearing masks and would bring hand sanitizer at the table for customers - The cocktails were GREAT. Very flavorful and balanced. The Zephyr one is just prime. - The sushi experiences was excellent. Very fresh, very tasty and the menu selection is varied. Wide choice for Nigiri and Sashimi

Tonight, I ordered in from Zeppelin and it was spectacular. I was so happy with the service when I arrived to pick up the food. We came home and devoured our sushi because it was so good. We would highly recommend the yellowtail nigiri as well as the spicy salmon roll if you’re looking for a little yummy kick! Go Zeppelin (the place with the Godzilla outside) and you will not be disappointed!
Sushi time 😊
Ok sushi, ok staff. I'd go back

My party of 2 stood at the host stand to be seated for at least 10 minutes without being addressed AT ALL. Not a hello, not a please wait, nothing! A line began to accumulate behind us and still not a word or even  a single glance from the staff. Did not done. Would not recommend!
I always wanted to try this place and I finally did today.. and I’m so glad I did it’s so good and Fresh
Takeout during COVID. Sushi rolls were good, nothing really notable for me to return and thought it was overpriced for qty. not a good value.

I could not be more happy to have a place like this so close to my home. The drinks were amazing and enough reason to come in and stay but the piece of the business that hit out of the park was the sushi. 👏👏👏. The service also checked the box for perfect.
Fun outdoor patio atmosphere. I really enjoyed the sushi and cocktails.

Horrible experience. They don't take reservations we specifically called and asked if they we're busy she said no plenty of tables and when we arrived 30 minutes later the "host" said the ppl answering the phones aren't aware of the actual wait times. That's preposterous.
Great Sushi!  Nice outdoor "city" patio.

I enjoyed Zeppelin’s omakase with a few friends a few months ago. We’re all avid sushi eaters who regularly enjoyed Morimoto growing up.  Zeppelin knocked our socks off. The fish was fresh and prepared with a high level of precision. We watched as a sous chef was preparing a tuna roll for another party and discarded a piece of fish that looked delicious to us. When asked, he said he wouldn’t serve that piece when they had a higher quality piece under the counter.  Our meal consisted of 3 appetizers (new to all of us), a bowl of miso soup and then servings of sashimi and sushi. They were happy to prepare alternatives to shrimp/eel at our request.  Can’t wait for Zeppelin to reopen!
Had a great table out on the patio.  Best sea weed salad ever.  Refreshing cocktails.  Dragon roll and Chaplin rolls were highlights
Super, great food good service
We sat down for 20 minutes without a single server to even talk to us about the menu. It's a Monday night and the place wasn't extremely busy. We had no choice but walked out.
Fun layout of upstairs restaurant - we sat a group of 5 on the long table in the middle of the room. Good assortment on the menu - way beyond just sushi.
Exorbitant pricing for average sushi and yakitori in a deafening well-decorated space not suited for weekends if you want to enjoy dinner and drinks

The sushi is certainly above average, but it doesn't warrant the expense. Other DC establishments are far superior, like Sushi Hachi, given the ingredients, variety, and atmosphere. Zeppelin was ear-bleedingly loud as tables of patrons are forced to out-scream each other to be heard. The ambiance was terrible, but the service was quite good. Given I can get high-quality sushi in much more comfortable settings at much better prices, I can't imagine choosing to return here.
Great sushi and great drinks
The host is the best person ever!
Great place for sushi and cocktails
Very eclectic

Outstanding sushi, great cocktails, and atmosphere. The waygu beef appetizer and the crunchy spicy scallop roll are amazing Like most DC restaurants it is a little loud, but that's par for the course in DC. Besides from the awesome food, one thing that sets them apart is karaoke after dinner (~1030pm), which is a blast! Crazy to go from sushi to singing, so we are definitely coming back.
Service was outstanding.

Great atmosphere and tasty food. The mural on the side of the building is fantastic! We sat in the upstairs dining room & took off before the karaoke started. The special Sweetheart roll was both beautiful & yummy. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in DC.
Love, love, love this place
Outstanding and creative sushi.  We like the dining area and the bar.  Popular place and it does get busy.
Great atmosphere.  Super sweet bartender.

The service was out of this world. They were backed up when we went there but they went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed while we were waiting for our food and they were very transparent about it. My whole group was just impressed by the food, service, and professionalism. The host downstairs was also one of the nicest person ever. You must get the sushi rice when you go here- it is literally the best I've ever had. This is a great place for a casual drinks dinner situation or to host a birthday dinner. I cannot recommend this place enough.
Great local sushi spot with one of the best happy hour menus in the city. Staff is super friendly and helpful.
You want omasake. You want nigiri. Come here.

Nice neighborhood bar, just dropped in for a wine... Good to have that option in Shaw.  I have been here several times, enjoyed all the menu items, the cocktails are superb, and atmosphere-staff-experience are on point!
Great bar the awful loud karaoke
Love this place. The food is legit and the decor is remarkable. Wish I could have stayed for karaoke.

Really enjoyed the Omakase at the sushi bar. Great value at $100pp—3 appetizers, 8pc sashimi, and 12pc sushi (plus soup and dessert). On par with decent places in NYC, and at a lower price. Chef Kevin paced it out nicely. Very relaxed vibe throughout the restaurant.  Main issue was the wait staff. Although friendly, it’s clear that this place doesn’t prioritize the Omakase, so dirty dishes would get piled up as we waited for our waiter to eventually come around. At the end they brought out two desserts, as expected, but then only left one at the table and didn’t seem to know what to do with the other. Moments later we saw the staff eating our other dessert just 10 feet away from us.
Sushi special premium was phenomenal. Their sushi is best in town! I will definitely be back.
Expensive but good quality food.  Recommend the house hot sake
The place is the best place for sushi in town. Period.
Always great food and drinks.  One of our favorite go to spots.
Best sushi I have had by far
Sushi was fine, service took forever. On the bright side drinks were free because it took so long though!
Service was amazing

Visiting from Florida and we cross paths with some regulars at another restaurant who recommended Zeppelins for great high quality drinks for a more than fair price ($15 for Blue Label Johnny Walker is a steak). The bartenders, staff, and manager are very professional, friendly and provide amazing customer service. The drinks are unique and taste superb. Margo and Maddie are the bartenders ensured we had a good time and provided some great areas to explore. Dave the manager was down to earth and easy to talk to.  If you like a nice environment, great drinks, and great sushi this is the place.  Photo of The Baldwin Drink
Good restaurant

(Translated by Google) The site very nice, a great deal. The chef explained how to eat the dishes to optimize the taste to the fullest, super nice and helpful. A reference site, we will definitely return!  (Original) El sitio muy agradable, un trato genial. El cocinero nos explicó como comer los platos para optimizar el sabor al máximo, súper agradable y servicial. Un sitio de referencia, indudablemente volveremos!

Happy hour is 4-7pm on Sappora beer ($3), champagne $8) and mixed drinks ($5). Sushi is pretty good and decently priced. Nisa was an amazing server and even reminded us to get in some drink orders before happy hour ended. The upstairs turns into a karaoke bar on the weekends and is a great time and the crowd is usually a good mix of friendly people to sing with.
Menu includes Japanese food that is cooked too, not just raw fish. Nice wine selection.
Great place
So much fun!  The karaoke was awesome!  Food and drinks were superb as well.  Good times had by all and hope to do it again soon.  I highly recommend!
Good sushi

Delicious okonomiyaki, and takoyaki. Sushi is incredibly fresh. The prices are reasonable, especially for DC. Nice happy hour specials too, honestly.  I'll be back for sure.  Probably on a Tuesday, when they have their sake discounted.
Tuesday has a great sake special! Great food all around.
Stopped by last week with my family. I'm very impressed! The food is tasty, service is quick and friendly. We will be back for sure.
Sushi was pretty good. The other stuff on the menu was not. Servers could be more knowledgeable about the food, sake, etc. Very loud for dinner and becomes a karaoke bar upstairs at night.

Went here a second time with the first being when they opened a few months ago. The sushi was good, fresh, when I finally got it. Service was unbearably slow with us waiting upwards to an hour to get our food. To top it off, our server didn’t think to check the reverse side of our sushi selection card so only half of our order was prepared and came out. I was not going to wait another hour for sushi so we decided to leave at that point.  As before, the sushi was fresh and good overall, however service was extremely lacking. Go here, but don’t go on a busy night.
Yum yum yum! Delicious sushi and very tasty drinks. Lovely porch setting for when it's nice out. I'd highly recommend the "sushi special premium" -- just the right size for a very hungry person.

Very cool new bar. Nice menu, good cocktails and nice good menu. Maddy was a fantastic bartender. Updated: Came back for dinner and the food was not as good as the drinks and pretty expensive for whatever got. Disappointing.

Don't miss this one if you're over the shaw direction. Fair price at the quality level, really nice spread of awesome non-sushi items (I'm biased on anywhere with yakitori and cabbage pancakes) and was very happy with sushi taste/quality. 3 for 3 on the cocktails we ordered.

This is a cool hip place, the sushi is off the hook, the Drifter Cocktails on their menu have an interesting twist on some old fashioned drinks (Stone Cutter and Simple Twist of Fate) are prime examples. They have a Yakitori Grill with alot of choices . They do Karaoke every night of the week. This is definitely a place that I recommend.
Just unique, in everything. The quality of food is excellent.
Stellar staff, busy place but sushi was well worth the wait
Great spot for groups dinners and fresh sushi 🍣

The best place there is to eat sushi! It was the first time I tried sushi, I had always been afraid by the diseases that the shrimp were not fresh, but these were definitely very rich all, the price certainly at the level of what you serve and the best is the luxurious care I gave, made my food a truly good experience!
The food was good, but the restaurant is terribly loud making conversation difficult. Also, the sushi menu's text was so small I needed a magnifying glass to read it.
Very misleading happy hour menu. Waiter told us that all of the items on the highball list were half off, but then charged us full price because only one item was discounted. Disappointing.
I've been to Zeppelin twice. The food has been amazing both times. The service is attentive, and the drink menu is nicely curated. This place is becoming my easy tasty go to when I'm in the district.
Very nice restaurant.

At the downstairs bar, one bartender served people on either side of us, waved at us mockingly while standing idly on one end and then not serve us, and the other bartender wouldn't stop talking to their friends. Drink was average.
Really really cool neighborhood bar. Attention to detail in the decor and drinks. Highly recommend
My favorite drink is the Tiger milk
Very good
Great bar staff who are super knowledgeable about the food and drink menus

(Translated by Google) It ’s not bad for a Japanese sushi restaurant in the DC! But hope they improve the quality of rice for nigiri sushi. Otherwise I ca n’t call it an authentic Japanese sushi restaurant.  The amount of shari is a good feeling, but it's different from the one that you can eat in Japan. But the story is delicious. If you really want to eat sushi, you may come again.  (Original) I visited here during the restaurant week. It’s not bad for a Japanese sushi restaurant in the DC! but hope they improve the quality of rice for nigiri sushi. Otherwise I can’t call it an authentic Japanese sushi restaurant.  握りのシャリの量は的確でいい感じなのに日本で食べるトロけるシャリとはやっぱり違う。でもネタは美味しい。お寿司がどうしても食べたくなったらまた来るかも。
Intimate and nice patio.

This place thinks that 7 pieces of vegetables that are flash fried in a light tempura batter is worth $14. It was good, as was their okonomiaki, but some of their prices were weirdly high for what you get
Good sushi
Great mixed selection of small plates (Japanese style) and interesting drinks. Plus over 50 bottles of sake on the wine list. Beautiful patio and fun atmosphere.  Good drinks and delicious food.
Amazing suzhi for a great value
Great drinks and food.  Well priced for the level of quality.  Pleasently surprised and will be back.  The seafood pancake thingy was awesome.
It was amazing. Strongly believe it deserves nothing less than 5 stars.
Great food and drinks. Really well decorated and in an awesome location.
Great kareoke situation upstairs. Super fun!!!
The quality of their fish is not remotely worth the price they charge.
Great atmosphere and excellent sushi.
9th and U street location. Sister to Chaplin. Great outdoor seating. Food is nicely priced and very tasty. Alao have upstairs seating. Great place to put in neighborhood rotation.
Best mid-range sushi restaurant in the district!

Incompetence masquerading as a restaurant. Front of the house is chaos. Poor table management lead to a 30 minute wait to be seated for a reserved party in a relatively empty dining room. Noise levels are unbearable. The space appears to double as a night club and could stand to benefit from some noise management from a dining and DJing perspective. Menu is straight forward and traditional but executed in an average fashion. For Ogawa's best, head to his eponymous establishment in Dupont.
Great food and service, sushi is really good but cocktails and other Japanese dishes are unique, authentic and delicious.
Sushi quality was A++ Very fresh and melt in your month sashimi. The ginger beer is a perfect non-alcoholic option.
Good food!
Excellent sushi, fresh. Good service.

Came here with my family and ordered pretty much everything on the menu. Very tasty and creative. We especially enjoyed the salmon with the mango sauce and the raw octopus. Good selection on drinks. Kind of like Japanese tapas!

Great drinks and even better food. I enjoyed the sushi, scotch and people here to the fullest. There are a lot of restaurants in the city but this is effectively combines food, drinks and people. Pull up, you won’t be disappointed.
Very good quality fish.. Trendy place!
Fantastic service. Lovely neighborhood bar/restaurant.

The sushi here is solid and tasty, reasonably priced, and there’s a hefty selection. I will always miss my hometowns sushi place because it has a huge selection of vegetable sushi, including tomago, but the tempura vegetables here are delicious. A decent drink menu and a beautiful outdoor patio make this a great place for an evening meal. Enjoy!
Amazing food, the sushi was really fresh. Staff was extremely nice as well.
Delicious and reasonably priced!!
The hostess and bartenders were on different pages, there is only one bathroom, and the whole experience wasn't the best. Good selection of Japanese craft beer and spirits.

If there were more than 5 stars, I'd be giving more! On our visit we tasted a number of items on the menu and were impressed by everything. Zeppelin stands head and shoulders above many DC eating experiences. The O'o Toro (tuna) and Chu Toro (salmon) sashimi were excellent. The Ebi Shumai was phenomenal as well. I couldn't be happier with the service and ambiance as well. I will definitely be returning. Keep up the good work guys!
Super cool bar with some of the best sushi i've had in DC and amazing cocktails. Insanely good sake selection!

We were able to finally snag a reservation here and  ended up having mixed feelings. It was really loud since is it a small place. We did the omakase since we love sushi and were served cold miso soup with ice cold tofu in it. The selection of fish was standard but for the price, I was expecting more of a high end omakase. What saved the meal were the appetizers. If we go back, it will be for the few pieces of the omakase we enjoyed and the appetizers.
Sleek space with large outdoor seating area.  Good selection of food and drinks.
Food was delightful drinks on point

Sushi tasted the same as the sushi at the supermarket (maybe a step down from supermarket sushi). Restaurant was way too cold. Every single person eating dinner was wearing their coat/jacket (including men) and clearly freezing. It was 52 degrees outside and they had the air conditioning blasting.

This restaurant has a lot going for it.  Great lighting and design feels current and trendy.  I particularly enjoyed their version of the Old Fashion with a splash of plum.  I enjoyed the tempura shrimp more than the vegetables which were alittle too dense.  The shrimp was perfect. Plenty of drink and sushi options.

We came here for drinks to celebrate a friend's birthday. We ended up ordering a LOT of food as well due to how good the food was - which pleasantly surprised us! We sat at the bar/hung out around the bar area, as there was almost a 2-hour wait on a Saturday night. Major kudos to the bartender Micah - he was patient, good-spirited, accommodating, and just all-around pleasant - which you don't see often in a DC bartender these days! The mixed drinks were delicious. Top favorites included the Kabuki Springs, the Baldwin, and the Getaway. Our group also tried and ended up buying a bottle of the Nobushi Japanese whiskey - different and good. We ordered the shrimp tempura, gyu don, and several yakitoris including chicken thighs, shishito, shiitake, and beef tongue. All the food was quite good - we kept ordering more of the shishito and chicken thighs! The entire bar/restaurant was very lively the duration of our visit with the second floor extremely lively with karaoke. There's a nice little outdoor area with seating as well. We didn't have to search too long for street parking close by either. The only caveats of Zeppelin - drinks are quite expensive, even for DC. Also, wish there were bathrooms on the first floor - the 2 unisex bathrooms on the 2nd floor made it a hassle. Regardless, we found a new enticing spot in DC - we'd definitely be back!
Love the new addition to shaw. The cocktails are amazing.

atmosphere = 10/10! Lovely, creative, light drinks, fun outdoor seating space, perfect for warm evenings. Only drawbacks were that the food was not super memorable (and over-priced) and the first floor bathroom (very cool aesthetic, but one major design flaw: toilets are SUPER hard to see and they're black...no way of knowing what you're sitting in...just makes it feel like it's not super clean)  TLDR: stay for the drinks, the atmosphere, the karaoke, the outdoor seating, not for the food or the bathrooms
Go for the sushi (it’s REALLY GOOD), stay for the karaoke! Rarely do two really good things come together so well. Seriously, this place is amazing

Incredible restaurant! We've been hoping something like this would open close to our home. The yakitori and appetizers were the best Japanese food we've had outside Japan and reminded us exactly of a the Izakaya on the first floor of our AirBnB in Tokyo. The sushi was also of extremely high quality, and had many more interesting fish to try than you usually see (try the Ice Fish if it's available), including baby squid, amberjack and even barracuda.
Lovely neighborhood eatery. Great ambiance, beautiful bar.
Innovative food. Superlative hand-crafted cocktails. Inspiring service.

There are only a few really amazing Japanese places in Columbia heights/shaw are that give you that unique balance of good sushi, great atmosphere and solid pricing. Zeppelin is on that very short list. The asthetic and atmosphere make it the go to for your happy hour, date night, and chill with friends evenings. This great sushi place will be going into my repertoire of great places to take friends and loved ones. The ONLY THING I would ask, is that they start carrying Orion beer. If you are really going to be a Japanese restaurant, you have to carry it. If you start carrying Orion, you will be my #1.
Zeppelin's food is divine! If you prefer to dine with little ambient noise definitely go earlier in the evening. Must haves are: ebi shumai, tempura, and the hinoki springs highball!
Came here with some friends. Great Food, Great Atmosphere.
Tasty Japanese food, good beer selection and fun atmosphere
Love this place..great food and great vibe.  Will come back as often as I come to DC.  Service and drinks are 5 star too
(Translated by Google) It's a very nice place and they treat it well to a  (Original) Es un lugar bien lindo y lo tratan bien a un
The service is excellent and the food is fresh.
The sushi was AMAZING, will definitely be back for karaoke too!
Amazing food and service! And Atmosphere is so fun!!!! Great place for karoake!
The bar a Suntory Highball machine ! Expect amazing drinks and selection with an amazing space !

Went for the omakase and simply put, it’s amazing. The fish was melt in your mouth fresh and probably the best I think I’ve ever had. I will be returning with friends to share this incredibly delicious experience.

Beautiful bar. I wasn't a fan of the yakitori don,  but the chicken meatball skewer was amazing and the Kalbi was a divine experience for each piece. The menu is filled with a ton of interesting options; the vegetable tempura did not disappoint.  Drinks: The bartenders knew their whiskey and if they didn't, took the time to taste it with us. Great selection of Japanese whiskeys. They have a fancy sparkling water machine that most of their cocktails take advantage of, so if you're a fan of fizzy drinks you're in the good place.  The cocktails I ordered trended towards sweet-- highly recommend the Zephyr. It's made with Pandan, the taste is undescribable. Just try it.

My wife and I just got back from Japan and South Korea. The sushi here at Ari’s restaurant is better than anything we had in Asia and we ate at some really nice places over there.  I’m blown away at the quality. Hats off, Ari & Micah!
